text:
6. Conclusion

In conclusion, the use of antipsychotic medications in conjunction with

hormonal contraceptives can lead to increased levels of certain hormones,

which may result in an increased risk of thromboembolic events. However, a

study published in the Journal of Clinical Psychopharmacology found that the

use of antipsychotics with hormonal contraceptives was associated with

improved symptoms and quality of life in patients with schizophrenia. Further
